role.name: /PEN
role.desc: This is a programming enable pin for the SPI Serial Programming mode. By holding this pin low during a Power-on Reset, the device will enter the SPI Serial Programming mode. PEN has no function during normal operation. PEN can be also pulled to VCC, this doesn't bother possibility of programming.

role.name: PDI
role.desc: ISP Serial Programming Data input. During serial program downloading, this pin is used as data input line (MOSI line of the programatora).

role.name: RXD0
role.desc: Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 0

role.name: PDO
role.desc: ISP Serial Programming Data output. During Serial Program Downloading, this pin is used as data output line (MISO line of the programmer).

role.name: TXD0
role.desc: Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 0

role.name: AIN0
role.desc: Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

role.name: AIN1
role.desc: Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

role.name: OC3A
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter3 Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter3 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC3A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: INT4
role.desc: External Interrupt source 4 to the MCU.

role.name: OC3B
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter3 Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter3 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC3B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: INT5
role.desc: External Interrupt source 5 to the MCU.

role.name: OC3C
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter3 Output compare matchC output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter3 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC3C pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: INT6
role.desc: External Interrupt source 6 to the MCU.

role.name: INT7
role.desc: External Interrupt source 7 to the MCU.

role.name: /SS
role.desc: Slave Select pin for using with SPI.

role.name: SCK
role.desc: Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI. Used while programming.

role.name: MOSI
role.desc: Data input pin for SPI only. Not for programming MCU.

role.name: MISO
role.desc: Data output pin for SPI only. Not for programming MCU.

role.name: OC0
role.desc: 8-bit Timer/Counter0 Output Compare Match Output. Pin can serve as an external output for timer 0 compare match. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function.

role.name: OC1A
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: OC1B
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: OC1C
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Output compare matchC output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC1C pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: TOSC2
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Oscillator pin 2 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1.

role.name: TOSC1
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Oscillator pin 1 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1.

role.name: /RESET
role.desc: Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

role.name: XTAL2
role.desc: Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output).

role.name: XTAL1
role.desc: Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input).

role.name: INT0
role.desc: External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU.

role.name: SCL
role.desc: 2-wire Serial Interface Clock: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Clock I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal.

role.name: INT1
role.desc: External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU.

role.name: SDA
role.desc: 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.

role.name: INT2
role.desc: External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU.

role.name: RXD1
role.desc: Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 1.

role.name: INT2
role.desc: External Interrupt source 3 to the MCU.

role.name: TXD1
role.desc: Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 1

role.name: /WR
role.desc: Write strobe signal for XRAM, active low.

role.name: /RD
role.desc: Read strobe signal for XRAM, active low

role.name: TDI
role.desc: JTAG - Test Data In. Serial input data to be shifted in to the Instruction Register or Data Register (Scan Chains).

role.name: TDO
role.desc: JTAG - Test Data Out. Serial output data from Instruction register or Data Register.

role.name: TMS
role.desc: JTAG - Test Mode Select. This pin is used for navigating through the TAP-controller.

role.name: TCK
role.desc: JTAG - Test Clock. JTAG operation is synchronous to TCK.
